result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darcy L Jacobson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darcy L Jacobson in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss and use as read-in to case # 17CF63.

Court: case dismissed and read-in to 17CF63
combined bond 14 CM 94, 15 CM 210, 14 CT 10 and 15 CM 280.  Absolute sobriety.

Defendant Darcy L Jacobson in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli via phone.  Defendant Darcy L Jacobson in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 15 CM 210, 14 CT 10 and 15 CM 280.   State addressed the Court as to bail - $5000.00 cash bond on all 4 files - no alcohol.  Atty Cirilli addressed the court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

10:10 AM Defendant Darcy L Jacobson not in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gary S. Cirilli in court for Defendant Darcy L Jacobson. 
Atty Cirilla does not know where client is. State requests warrant and bond forfeiture. Atty Cirilla objects and requests continuance.
Court authorizes warrant with $ 5000.00 cash endorsement and forfeiture of bond.

9:52 AM  Attorney Gary S. Cirilli in court.  Def did not appear. Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Cirilli has not heard from client. Did not call court.  State requests warrant and forfeiture proceedings.
Court issues warrant with $2,500.00 cash endorsement and forfeiture proceedings. 

10:37 AM

 Defendant Darcy L Jacobson in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court addresses parties. Atty Cirilli states parties are close to agreement.  Court QUASHES warrant.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Absolute Sobriety
Not to operate a motor vehicle without valid permit.
SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Random Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 24 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
